item.title: Israel to reopen Gaza crossing after search for last dead hostage's body ends
item.description: Israel's military says its troops are searching for the remains of Ran Gvili, reportedly at a cemetery in northern Gaza.

item.title: Kenya's ex-deputy president alleges assassination attempt in church attack
item.description: The interior minister condemned the attack, which police say they are investigating.

item.title: Gold tops $5,000 for first time ever, adding to historic rally
item.description: Gold is seen as a so-called safe-haven asset that investors buy in times of uncertainty and low interest rates.

item.title: Uganda's military chief denies army assaulted Bobi Wine's wife
item.description: Barbara Kyagulanyi, married to the opposition leader, says she refused to reveal her husband's whereabouts.

item.title: Deadly winter storm grips large parts of the US
item.description: A powerful winter storm swept across the country, with heavy snow, ice and dangerously low temperatures affecting millions.
